column5: Welcome to Covid-19 questionnaire section...What can I do for you?
Welcome to Covid-19 questionnaire section...What can I do for you?

column2: MAY I KNOW THE SYMPTOMS OF THIS VIRUS
column5: The most common symptoms of COVID-19 are fever#Comma tiredness#Comma and dry cough. Some patients may have aches and pains#Comma#Newline nasal congestion#Comma runny nose#Comma sore throat or diarrhea. These symptoms are usually mild and begin gradually.

column2: HOW TO SECURE ME FROM THIS VIRUS
column5: Wash your hands frequently#NewlineRegularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water.

column2: ANYTHING ELSE I HAVE TO KNOW
column5: Follow the guidance outlined above (Protection measures for everyone)

Self-isolate by staying at home if you begin to feel unwell#Comma even with mild symptoms such as headache#Comma low grade fever (37.3 C or above) and slight runny nose#Comma until you recover. If it is essential for you to have someone bring you supplies or to go out#Comma e.g. to buy food#Comma then wear a mask to avoid infecting other people.
COVID-19 is the infectious disease caused by the most recently discovered coronavirus.

If you develop fever#Comma cough and difficulty breathing#Comma seek medical advice promptly as this may be due to a respiratory infection or other serious condition. Call in advance and tell your provider of any recent travel or contact with travelers.
Calling in advance will allow your health care provider to quickly direct you to the right health facility. This will also help to prevent possible spread of COVID-19 and other viruses.

column2: IF I HAVE MORE QUERIES WHAT I HAVE TO DO?
column5: For more information#Comma check back regularly on WHOs coronavirus pages. https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019
